name: FifthTry
headline: Continuous Documentation To End Documentation Rot
description: FifthTry is a Notion-like documentation tool designed to end documentation rot. We integrate with GitHub and block code changes from getting deployed till documentation has been updated and approved. We call this Continuous Documentation.
generated_description:
### FifthTry: Ending Documentation Rot with Continuous Documentation

**Company Overview**  
Founded in 2020 and hailing from Bengaluru, India, FifthTry is a smart solution aimed directly at a common problem in the tech world: documentation rot. With their mission of promoting **Continuous Documentation**, FifthTry empowers teams to keep their documentation up-to-date by integrating their tool with GitHub, preventing code changes from being deployed until the corresponding documentation is updated and approved.

**What They Offer**  
FifthTry is akin to a Notion-like documentation tool, but it carries a significant twist. Their unique integration with version control systems means that the days of neglecting documentation are over. This is crucial for teams maintaining high-quality codebases, as documentation often takes a back seat, the result being outdated records that lead to inefficiencies and confusion.

They are part of the **Y Combinator Batch W21**, which speaks volumes about their potential and credibility in the startup ecosystem. Currently, FifthTry operates with a compact team of four and is keen on expanding its reach and solutions.

**Use Cases and Future Plans**  
A standout aspect of FifthTry is its focus on non-technical users. The company is passionately developing tools that allow users—regardless of technical expertise—to create, host, and manage websites effortlessly. Their upcoming product, **fastn**, is designed as a user-friendly open-source programming language and full-stack framework that users can learn in just a week. This positions FifthTry not only as a documentation solution but also as a facilitator of website development for non-coders.

Their features enable rapid website launches, seamless updates, and effective collaboration, making it a favorite among tech enthusiasts, as evidenced by the praise from over 3,000 satisfied users.

**Overall Vision**  
The problem that FifthTry tackles is foundational for any team relying on documentation and code quality. They uniquely blend documentation management with the intricacies of software development, making it essential for teams striving to keep their projects up-to-date and comprehensible. This approach places user experience at the forefront, ensuring that even non-technical team members can contribute meaningfully to website management and documentation.

For those interested, more information can be found at their website: [FifthTry.com](https://www.FifthTry.com). Keep an eye on FifthTry; they're not just trying to make documentation less of a chore—they aim to transform it into a seamless part of the development process.
